title: SYSTEM$GET_COMPUTE_POOL_STATUS | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Available to accounts in AWS and Microsoft Azure commercial regions, with some exceptions. For more information, see Available regions.
Retrieves status of a compute pool.
Returns status information as a JSON object. The JSON fields are:
message. Message relevant to the status, if any. Otherwise, this field is empty.

The current role must have the MONITOR privilege on the compute pool to get the
status information.

The message in the response may mention capacity error. It means the instance type you requested is currently not
available with the cloud provider. You can either try creating compute pool a few minutes later or choose another instance type.
The following function retrieves status information for the “mypool” compute pool.
